Utility to split an index into smaller chunks.

Spence Koehler

Constructor Detail

IndexSplitter

protected IndexSplitter(java.io.File indexToSplit,
                        int numDocsPerSplit,
                        java.io.File destContainer,
                        java.lang.String splitNamePrefix,
                        java.lang.String splitNameSuffix,
                        org.apache.lucene.analysis.Analyzer analyzer,
                        DocumentConverter converter)
Construct to split the index at the given location into indexes at the destination location.

Each chunk should have at most numDocsPerSplit documents.

Each chunk should be named splitNamePrefix + nextId + splitNameSuffix.

Don't split the index if it is already smaller than numDocsPerSplit.

Don't optimize the newly built indexes.

Parameters:
indexToSplit - Path to the index that is to be split.
numDocsPerSplit - Maximum number of documents to hold in each chunk.
destContainer - Directory to contain the split indexes.
splitNamePrefix - Prefix for numbered index names.
splitNameSuffix - Suffix for numbered index names.
analyzer - Analyzer to use.
converter - Document converter.
Method Detail

generateDocument

protected abstract org.apache.lucene.document.Document generateDocument(org.apache.lucene.document.Document storedDoc)
Given a document retrieved from the existing index that contains only stored fields, create a full document to be added to the new index.

split

public boolean split()
              throws java.io.IOException
Execute the split.

Note that an index already smaller than the split size will NOT be split.

Returns:
true if the index was split; otherwise, false.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
